## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
data <- retrieve_VST_data(site = "OSBS", start = 2019)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r tidyverse, echo=FALSE}
plots <- data$vst_perplotperyear %>% 
  filter(siteID %in% c("HARV", "DSNY", "SCBI", "SERC", "JERC", #not available for 2018
                       "GUAN", "STEI", "UNDE", "KONZ",
                       "UKFS", "GRSM", "MLBS", "ORNL",
                       "DELA", "LENO", "TALL", "DCFS",
                       "WOOD", "STER", "CLBJ", "OAES",
                       "MOAB", "NIWO", "JORN", "WREF", 
                       "SJER", "SOAP", "TOOL", "DEJU", "PUUM")) %>%
  dplyr::filter(treesPresent == "Y") %>%
  dplyr::select(plotID, siteID, easting, northing, utmZone)
```
```{r tidyverse, echo=FALSE}
aop_retriever(plots, years=2018,
       products=c("DP3.30024.001","DP3.30006.001",
          "DP3.30025.001", "DP3.30025.001",
          "DP3.30015.001", "DP1.30003.001"))
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

```{r tidyverse, echo=FALSE}
crop_data_to_plot(dtprd=c("DP1.30003.001", "DP3.30006.001",
                             "DP3.30015.001", "DP3.30024.001", "DP3.30025.001"),
                                             plots[1:2,], bff=22)
```
